brief_summary.textblock: Compare the effect of volume expansion by saline versus albumin on the correction of peripheral tissue hypoperfusion by measuring Index skin recoloration time (CRT) at H0 and H1

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a transversal study allowing to compare the effect of volume expansion by saline versus albumin on the correction of peripheral tissue hypoperfusion
Design:
• A multicentric, open-label, transversal study
Sample size :
60 patients
Assessement:
Between 6 and 48 hours after admission, the patient will be included after information and collection of non-opposition. The patient will receive volume expansion either by 0.9% saline (500mL) or by 20% albumin (100mL) over 15 minutes.
Repeated clinical measurements will be performed every 30 minutes for 4 hours. A blood sample will be taken just before the volume expansion and 4 hours after, at the same time as the samples usually taken as part of the standard treatment.
No interim analysis is planned. Analysis will be performed at the end of the study after data review and freezing of data base.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the effect of volume expansion by saline versus albumin on the correction of peripheral tissue hypoperfusion by measuring Index skin recoloration time (CRT) at H0 and H1
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients who normalized their cutaneous re-coloring time (CRT) measured at the index level, defined by a value <3 seconds at H1. The clinical measurement method has been standardized in the participating departments and has been used for several years in clinical practice.

study_pop.textblock:
The study will be performed in patients with septic shock hospitalized in intensive care with signs of peripheral hypoperfusion persisting despite the initial resuscitation.
Patients will be eligible after 6 hours of management of septic shock, necessary for diagnostic management and hemodynamic optimization according to international standards including control of the source of infection, administration of antibiotics, volume expansion by crystalloids of at least 20 mL / kg and finally the administration of norepinephrine to maintain a MAP> 65mmHg.
Hemodynamic stabilization is defined as no increase in the dose of norepinephrine for at least 2 hours.
In total, patients with reanimated and hemodynamically stabilized septic shock will be included. The diagnostic and therapeutic management will comply in all points with the usual service protocol and

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria :
- Age> 18 years old
- Septic shock within 24 hours of admission in intensive care
- Stable dose of norepinephrine for at least 2 hours to maintain MAP> 65mmHg
- CRT index> 3 seconds despite the initial resuscitation (administration of antibiotics, filling of crystalloids of 20 mL / Kg, noradrenaline started) between H6 and H48 from admission in intensive care
- Non-opposition of the patient collected by the senior doctor in charge of the patient between H0 and H6 after admission if the patient is vigilant, otherwise a procedure of collecting non-opposition from relatives will be carried out with collection of the non-opposition of the patient once he is able to give it.
- Affiliation to a social security system (excluding AME)
Exclusion Criteria:
- COVID19 patient (+)
- Pregnant and lactating woman
- Patient under Guardianship / Curatorship
- Refusal to participate
- CRT not evaluable (dark or damaged skin)
- Moribund patient
- Estimated life expectancy less than 1 month
- Participation in another interventional research involving the human person or period of exclusion at the end of a previous research involving the human person
